result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:14 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Serenity L Morgan in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Serenity L Morgan.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed in the document.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Pursuant to the offer the Court orders this case be dismissed and read into 21CM2137.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:54 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Serenity L Morgan in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Serenity L Morgan.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update; he is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

1:03 PM Defendant Serenity L Morgan in court.  Attorney Eryn Menden in court for Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez for Serenity L Morgan. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
